headline: Why Lululemon Stock Shot Up Today
summary: Shares of apparel company Lululemon Athletica (NASDAQ: LULU) shot up on Friday after the company provided a solid financial report for its third quarter of 2024 and raised its full-year guidance.  As of 3 p.m. ET, Lululemon stock was up 16%.  It's been a good earnings season for apparel stocks, generally speaking, but I don't wish to take anything from Lululemon.

headline: Lululemon CEO optimistic about 'long runway of growth' in Americas
summary: Shares of Lululemon Athletica (LULU) are soaring in Friday’s session on the back of strong third quarter results. The athletic apparel company raised its full-year revenue forecast after beating estimates across the top and bottom line, thanks in large part to the brand's strength in international markets. Lululemon CEO Calvin McDonald spoke with Yahoo Finance host Julie Hyman about the athleisure brand's performance. Lululemon’s growth in China was a particular bright spot, where comparable sales grew 27% during the quarter; that’s compared to a 2% decline in the Americas market. McDonald believes Lululemon’s community-focused model has played a significant role in that success, noting that its strong foundation “allows us to continue to grow and withstand some macro challenges.” While acknowledging that growth in the US and the Americas has been slower, McDonald remains optimistic about the brand’s prospects, especially in the women’s category. "There’s no doubt in my mind that we have a long runway of growth still in the Americas," he says, attributing that the slowing US growth to “missed opportunities in newness.” Which has been a big focus going forward as McDonald says "there’s a lot of really exciting newness” coming in the new year. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Wealth here. This post was written by Kathleen Welch.

headline: Lululemon stock jumps 15% on earnings. Is the leggings maker back?
summary: Lululemon (LULU) shares surge as investors digest the company's earnings beat fueled by strength in its sales outside the US. Despite the earnings fueled gains, the stock is still down double digits year-to-date. Catalysts Hosts Seana Smith and Madison Mills take a closer look at the stock move and what Wall Street analysts are saying about the results. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Catalysts here. This post was written by Naomi Buchanan.

headline: Lululemon shares surge as holiday demand helps lift forecast, results
summary: Lululemon Athletica shares jumped about 17% in early trading on Friday as an upbeat annual forecast raised investor optimism for a robust holiday quarter and prompted Wall Street to take a more bullish view on the stock.  The athleisure maker has refreshed its clothing line with trendier styles to attract younger shoppers and keep up with stiff competition from newer brands such as Vuori and Alo.  "Despite competitive threats, Lululemon's customers remain loyal," Raymond James analyst Rick Patel said.

"Despite competitive threats, Lululemon's customers remain loyal," Raymond James analyst Rick Patel said.

headline: US added 227,000 jobs in November, unemployment rate ticks higher: Yahoo Finance
summary: Investors are closely watching the November employment report, which showed that the US added 227,000 jobs last month. Economists had been expecting 220,000 jobs to be added, according to consensus estimates compiled by Bloomberg. The unemployment rate also rose to 4.2% compared to 4.1% in October. Trending tickers on Yahoo Finance include GameStop (GME), Lululemon Athletica (LULU), and Ulta Beauty (ULTA). Key guests include:8:30 a.m. ET - Steve Sosnick, Interactive Brokers, Chief Strategist and Robert Sockin, Citi, Senior Global Economist9:15 a.m. ET - Julie Su, Acting U.S. Labor Secretary9:45 a.m. ET - Rohit Kulkarni, Roth Capital Partners10:00 a.m. ET - Diane Swonk, KPMG U.S. Chief Economist10:30 a.m. ET - Mitchell Green, Lead Edge Capital Founder11:05 a.m. ET - Calvin McDonald, Lululemon CEO

headline: Lululemon's investment into China stores is 'paying off': Analyst
summary: Lululemon stock is in focus after the company reported an earnings beat, driven by its stores outside of the US. Morningstar senior equity analyst David Swartz joins Market Domination Hosts Julie Hyman and Josh Lipton to discuss the results. Swartz says, "The international sales growth was quite strong. Lululemon sales in the US and North America have slowed down. That's clear. But, the company still has a lot of potential for growth, both in China and Europe, and possibly other parts of Asia too. Right now, Lululemon is opening most of its stores in China, and that investment really seems to be paying off." The analyst adds, "These results suggest that Lululemon has overcome some of those problems. I think some of the merchandising issues still remain. The company has done some reorganization of its product development team, and it's going to be some time before some of these new designs and new products get into the stores. Probably not, potentially, until late 2025." Watch the video above for more on from the analyst on Lululemon's quarterly results and what's next for the athleisure brand. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination Overtime here. This post was written by Naomi Buchanan.
